intro: Rhaphidospora glabra, commonly known as the smooth-spored bryophyte, is a type of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its simple, leafy structure and the presence of smooth, non-ornate spores. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, called sporophytes, are usually small and inconspicuous. Rhaphidospora glabra plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
